intro: Cinchona rosea, commonly known as the pink quina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Cinchona rosea is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its historical association with the production of quinine, a compound used in medicine.
